headline: Crypto’s ‘Decentralized’ Illusion Shattered Again by Another AWS Meltdown
summary: The October AWS outage took down some of crypto’s most prominent companies and networks. Many in the community pointed out their lack of decentralization.

headline: Did S&P 500 Inclusion and Institutional Bets Just Shift Robinhood (HOOD)'s Investment Narrative?
summary: Robinhood Markets, Inc. recently experienced strong momentum following its inclusion in the S&P 500 index, notable business expansion into tokenized stocks and prediction markets, and increased institutional interest such as BlackRock raising its ownership stake to 7.2%. Alongside product innovation and the addition of new features like social media integration and short-selling capabilities, the company reported very large revenue growth year-over-year and has attracted considerably more...

headline: Amazon Cloud Reputation Takes Hit After Outage Lasting 15 Hours
summary: The incident, which some analysts are calling Amazon’s worst outage since 2021, reminded the world of the perils of depending on a handful of cloud companies to deliver crucial computing and internet services.  Outages like Monday’s strike at a core premise of the cloud: that a centralized operation full of sharp engineers will keep servers running better and more efficiently than individual companies’ own staff.

headline: AWS outage resolved: Which companies were affected the most?
summary: Everything from apps and website hosting to even your child's schoolwork portal were affected by Amazon's (AMZN) AWS outage on Monday. The company has since announced that the Amazon Web Services' cloud outage has been resolved. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley comes on the Morning Brief to highlight an assortment of companies and platforms most affected by the outage. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Amazon Suffers Major AWS Outage. Here’s 1 Stock That Can Profit From It
summary: Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Web Services (AWS) faced a significant outage yesterday centered in its US-EAST-1 region, triggered by issues with DynamoDB database services and DNS resolution failures. This disruption rippled globally, knocking out major platforms and businesses reliant on AWS infrastructure. headline: Tech Weekly: Amazon's major outage, Apple's new record
summary: STORY: From a major outage for Amazon's cloud unit to Apple's new record. This is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyAmazon's cloud services unit AWS was hit by a major global outage.It knocked out thousands of websites, disrupting businesses and some of the world's most popular apps, including Snapchat and Reddit.The issue marked the largest internet disruption since last year's CrowdStrike malfunction.Roblox, Coinbase and Robinhood were among some of the other big names affected.Apple became just the third company ever to hit a $4 trillion valuation.Shares surged after data firm Counterpoint showed sales of the new iPhone 17 series performing strongly.Investors were pleased to hear the newer models were outselling the previous iPhone 16 series by 14% during their first 10 days of availability in the U.S. and China.European aerospace firms could be closing in on a major satellite deal to take on U.S. giants.Sources said Leonardo, Airbus and Thales have reached a framework agreement on a proposed merger of their satellite businesses.They have reportedly been in talks for more than a year to create a new manufacturing company - codenamed 'Project Bromo'.It would compete with rivals led by Elon Musk's SpaceX, which owns the successful Starlink.And Alphabet's robotaxi unit Waymo showcased its self-driving Jaguar taxi at an event in New York City.It was to highlight a partnership with the city's Bronx Community College to develop and enhance an autonomous vehicle training programme. Waymo and Jaguar Land Rover teamed up in 2018 to design and engineer the all-electric car.

raw.headline: Tech Weekly: Amazon's major outage, Apple's new record
raw.summary: STORY: From a major outage for Amazon's cloud unit to Apple's new record. This is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyAmazon's cloud services unit AWS was hit by a major global outage.It knocked out thousands of websites, disrupting businesses and some of the world's most popular apps, including Snapchat and Reddit.The issue marked the largest internet disruption since last year's CrowdStrike malfunction.Roblox, Coinbase and Robinhood were among some of the other big names affected.Apple became just the third company ever to hit a $4 trillion valuation.Shares surged after data firm Counterpoint showed sales of the new iPhone 17 series performing strongly.Investors were pleased to hear the newer models were outselling the previous iPhone 16 series by 14% during their first 10 days of availability in the U.S. and China.European aerospace firms could be closing in on a major satellite deal to take on U.S. giants.Sources said Leonardo, Airbus and Thales have reached a framework agreement on a proposed merger of their satellite businesses.They have reportedly been in talks for more than a year to create a new manufacturing company - codenamed 'Project Bromo'.It would compete with rivals led by Elon Musk's SpaceX, which owns the successful Starlink.And Alphabet's robotaxi unit Waymo showcased its self-driving Jaguar taxi at an event in New York City.It was to highlight a partnership with the city's Bronx Community College to develop and enhance an autonomous vehicle training programme. Waymo and Jaguar Land Rover teamed up in 2018 to design and engineer the all-electric car.
